title: Blisters
description: Blisters should heal on their own within a week. They can be painful while they heal, but you shouldn’t need to see a GP.

header.value: Blisters should heal on their own within a week. They can be painful while they heal, but you shouldn’t need to see a GP.

value.caption: Blisters are small pockets of clear fluid under a layer of skin
value.alt: Blister on the heel of the foot, clear coloured and about the size of a 5 pence piece

value.caption: Blood blisters are red or black and filled with blood instead of clear fluid
value.alt: Blood blister on the sole of the foot below the toes, about the size of a 5 pence piece with slight swelling and red colour

value.caption: If the blister is infected it can be red, hot and filled with green or yellow pus
value.alt: Infected blister on the heel of the foot, swollen with pus that is tinged with green and yellow
